III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12713 Adoption placement record
Section • (5) The department must permanently retain all adoption
Description records for children adopted in Michigan under section 27b
of the probate code of 1939, 1939 PA 288, MCL 710.27b.
The adoption agency must forward any adoption records
for children adopted in Michigan to the department 1 year
after finalization of the adoption. The adoption agency may
not retain the original copies or any other copies of the
adoption records.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency did not have closed adoption records stored securely.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Complainant sent an email on 8/21/2025 indicating closed
adoption files were observed to be stored in an unlocked file room
alongside open adoption files. Complainant did not have any
additional information to provide.
Child Welfare Supervisor was interviewed by phone on
8/28/2025. She stated closed adoption files are being stored
within a file room that is open during the day and locked at night.
She stated the room contains open and closed files as well as the
agency copy machine and a clerical staff’s desk. Once the
adoption closes, the file is removed from a binder and placed in a
manilla envelope that is sealed and taped shut. Child Welfare
Supervisor stated they used to store their closed adoption files
separately in a locked room that only contained those files;
however, they became short on space in the building, so they
needed that room for as staff.
Program Director was interviewed by phone on 9/5/2025. She
stated closed adoption files are being stored within a file room.
She stated the closed adoption files are placed in a manilla
envelope that is sealed and taped shut. She stated they already
have a plan to lock the closed files separately in a locked cabinet.
TOUR OBSERVATION
8/26/2025 - DCWL CPA Consultant 1 completed an on-site visit at
the agency. She was let into the lobby through a locked door then
into the main office through a second locked door. Within the
agency office, there is room containing files that is locked at night
but remains unlocked during business hours. Within the file room,
the closed adoption files were observed on a shelf alongside open
adoption files.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
• PA 288 of 1939 – MCL 710.67(1) which states in part:
Except as otherwise provided in subsection (4) or in
section 68 of this chapter, records of proceeding in
adoption cases, including a notice files under
section 33(1) of this chapter, and a petition files
under section 34(1) of this chapter, and the papers
and books related to the proceedings shall be kept
in separate locked files and are not open to
2

inspection or copy except under order of a court of
record for good cause shown expressly permitting
inspection or copy.
• MDHHS Policy - ADM 1030, Access to Closed Records,
which states in part:
After adoption finalization, all adoption records are
closed. The records must be kept in separate locked
files and shall not be open to inspection or copying,
except as stated in disposition of records in this item.
• Photos taken by DCWL CPA Consultant on 8/26/2025:
o Photo 1 is taken from inside and office showing an
open door, a copy machine, open shelves with
binders containing open adoption files, and a table
with staplers, hole punches, and other office
accessories.
o Photo 2 is taken from another angle in the same
room and shows open shelves with binders
containing open files alongside open shelves with
stacked manilla envelopes containing closed files.
Analysis The agency is found in violation as it does not have closed
adoption files stored in separate locked files as required by
Michigan adoption code referenced in the cited licensing rule.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
